intro: Psychotria fraterna, commonly known as the "fraternal psychotria," is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of Central and South America. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes over 13,000 species, many of which are known for their ornamental or medicinal value. The plant is characterized by its opposite, elliptical leaves and small, tubular flowers that are typically greenish-white in color. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in the understory of rainforests. Psychotria fraterna is also notable for its role in traditional medicine and as a host plant for certain butterfly species.
